PageObject.StaticText:
A distribution with fixed shape parameters can be matched to a sample, using the location and scale parameters to match mean and deviation.
The shape parameters can sometimes also be used to get matching skewness and/or kurtosis. This is done before mean and deviation are matched, because mean and deviation are influenced by all parameters, and only shape parameters influence skewness and kurtosis, However this does not always work due to their nonlinear relation with the shape parameters.
There is no best way to find the best fitting approximation of a sample. It depends on the norm that is applied. For example, the lognormal distribution seems closer to the Extreme Value distribution when kurtosis is matched, while the Gamma distribution seems closer when skewness is matched.
When using operator DistributionInverseDensity, one should be aware that it is the density (the first derivative) of the inverse cumulative operator; not the inverse of the DistributionDensity operator!
